data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

abilities.name: Thick Skin
abilities.text: Raticate can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon (or Evolution card), a Trainer card, and an Energy card. Show them to your opponent and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attack, including damage, done to Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

data.name: Gothorita

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.

data.name: Chikorita

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Chikorita.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Chikorita does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sunrays.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Frogadier
data.flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.

data.name: Honedge

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Strange Scale
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Lucario

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Magnetic Ray
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it and switch that Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

data.name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

data.name: Probopass

attacks.name: Bounce Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

data.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Happy Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Chansey.

data.flavorText: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

data.name: Alolan Meowth

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.

data.name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Electripult
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

data.name: Kabu
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If your Active Pokémon is your only Pokémon in play, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Eternatus VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Eternal Zone
abilities.text: If all of your Pokémon in play are Darkness type, you can have up to 8 Pokémon on your Bench, and you can't put non-Darkness Pokémon into play. (If this Ability stops working, discard Pokémon from your Bench until you have 5.)

attacks.name: Dread End
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Darkness Pokémon in play.

data.name: Aron

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: In order to build up its steel body, it eats iron ore. This pesky Pokémon is known to eat railroad tracks.

data.name: Buneary

attacks.name: Bunny Hop
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crushing Headbutt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Crushing Headbutt.

data.flavorText: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.

data.name: Groudon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rip Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Raikou

attacks.name: Amazing Shot
attacks.text: This attack also does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

data.name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

data.name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Family Rescue
attacks.text: Shuffle 5 Psychic Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.

data.name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Spirited Drill
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of Nidorino's attacks does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

data.name: Forretress

abilities.name: Thorn Tempest
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Crash
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

abilities.name: Protective Dust
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, except damage, done to Venomoth by the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Quagsire

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.flavorText: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Eldegoss

attacks.name: Blessing of Fluff
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Luxray

attacks.name: Snarl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Whirlpool
attacks.text: Return 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon to your hand.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Look for Friends
attacks.text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Basic Pokémon. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Basic Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Pyroar

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

data.name: Mankey

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

data.flavorText: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.

data.name: Thundurus

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Disaster Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Upper Hand
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Marnie
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, you draw 5 cards, and your opponent draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

attacks.name: Brush Aside
attacks.text: If Sharpedo has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Swift Turn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Gabite

attacks.name: Gather Up
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Marvelous Shine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scale will heal even incurable illnesses.

data.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn ,any damage done to Clefairy by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

data.name: Decidueye-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Feather Arrow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hollow Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Light Venomoth

attacks.name: Mysterious Wing
attacks.text: Your opponent may choose a Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, or Evolution card from his or her discard pile and put it into his or her hand. Either way, you may do the same.

attacks.name: Synchronize
attacks.text: If Light Venomoth and the Defending Pokémon have a different number of Energy cards attached to them, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It defends itself by flapping its wings at high speed, spreading poisonous powder throughout the air.

attacks.name: Sonic Noise
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, that Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

abilities.name: Hard Cocoon
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Silcoon would be damaged by an opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 30.

attacks.name: Gooey Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

data.name: Empoleon

attacks.name: Recall
attacks.text: Choose an attack from 1 of this Pokémon's previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Aquafall
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Little Grudge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, discard an Energy attached to the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A being that exists as a thin gas. It can topple an Indian elephant by enveloping the prey in two seconds.

data.name: Boldore

attacks.name: Core Heal
attacks.text: Discard a Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal 50 damage from it.

data.flavorText: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Lightning Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Kabuto Armor
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does only half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

data.name: Chikorita
data.flavorText: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.

data.name: Pichu

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Electric Circuit
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 4 Lightning Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

data.flavorText: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.

data.name: Plusle

attacks.name: Draw for Everybody
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. It is said to have the ability to change the weather.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

data.name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

data.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Bright Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

data.name: Drifblim

attacks.name: Damage Transport
attacks.text: Move 4 damage counters from each of your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wind Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.

data.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Psychic Mirage
abilities.text: Each basic Psychic Energy attached to your Psychic Pokémon provides PsychicPsychic Energy. You can't apply more than 1 Psychic Mirage Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Deoxys-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Connect
abilities.text: Your Team Plasma Pokémon's attacks (excluding Deoxys-EX) do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Helix Force
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Mantyke

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mantine from your hand onto Mantyke (this counts as evolving Mantyke) and remove all damage counters from Mantyke.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.

attacks.name: Self Charge
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to Team Aqua's Electrike.

attacks.name: Invigorate
attacks.text: Choose 1 Basic Pokémon in any player's discard pile. Put it onto that player's Bench. Put a number of damage counters on that Pokémon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can't put a Pokémon on a Bench that's full.)

attacks.name: Pendulum Curse
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Pupitar

attacks.name: Dust Devil
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each non-Fighting Pokémon in play. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

data.name: Arceus LV.X
rules: You may have as many of this card in your deck as you like.
Put this card onto your Active Arceus. Arceus LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Multitype
abilities.text: Arceus LV. X's type is the same type as its previous Level.

abilities.name: Omniscient
abilities.text: Arceus can use the attacks of all Arceus you have in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

data.name: Castform

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Castform on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Weather Ball
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, remove 3 damage counters from Castform. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Wobbuffet

attacks.name: Shadowy Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Abra

attacks.name: Vanish
attacks.text: Shuffle Abra into your deck. (Discard all cards attached to Abra.)

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It teleports itself away from danger, making it difficult to capture.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damages times the number of heads.

data.name: Carbink BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Carbink BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Diamond Gift
attacks.text: Attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Fighting Pokémon.

data.name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

data.name: Scolipede

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.

data.name: Golett

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

data.name: Drampa

attacks.name: Dragon Wisdom
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Dragon Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

data.name: Doublade

attacks.name: Curse of the Blade
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it.

data.flavorText: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

data.name: Tentacool

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

data.name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Piloswine. Then, remove 4 damage counters from Piloswine.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.

data.name: Inteleon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snipe Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Zygarde

attacks.name: Lookout
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura Break
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Darkness or Fairy Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.

data.name: Beginning Door
rules: Search your deck for Arceus, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Gigalith

abilities.name: High Density Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, any damage done to this Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 50 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.

data.name: Diancie-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Luminous Swirl
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Milo
rules: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand, and draw 2 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Max Wind
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Press
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage if exactly 1 is heads, or 20 more damage if exactly 2 are heads, or 40 more damage if exactly 3 are heads, or 80 more damage if all 4 are heads.

data.flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Misty's Poliwhirl. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Phione

abilities.name: Whirlpool Suction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. If you do, discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and put it on the bottom of your deck.

data.flavorText: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: Ditch and Draw
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

data.name: Tapu Lele

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magical Swap
attacks.text: Move any number of damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon to their other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby) and remove all damage counters from Magby.

attacks.name: Ignite

data.name: Yamask

attacks.name: Transfer Pain
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

data.name: Castform Rain Form

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Rain Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Rain Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Rain Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

data.name: Jangmo-o

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.

data.name: Phantump

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Clefairy by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

data.name: Aegislash

attacks.name: Ticking Knock Out
attacks.text: During your next turn, if the Defending Pokémon is damaged by an attack, it will be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Draining Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

data.name: Nidoqueen

abilities.name: Queen's Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Power Lariat
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Evolution Pokémon on your Bench.

data.flavorText: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.

attacks.name: Clutch

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Lairon

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Lairon fight over territory, and when their steel bodies collide, sparks fly.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 1 more damage counter on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes

data.flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

attacks.text: If an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage to that Pokémon until the end of your next turn.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surrounding while it flies.

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

attacks.text: Sudowoodo does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

abilities.name: Restored Barrier

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

data.flavorText: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of Wishiwashi.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It creates an electric charge by rubbing its feathers together. It dances over to its enemies and delivers shocking electrical punches.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Zubat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Zubat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

abilities.name: Aqua Recycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Water Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Starmie is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

data.name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Upper Hand
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

abilities.name: Power Diffusion
abilities.text: As long as Rhydon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all damage done by attacks to all of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Tail
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

data.name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Cotton Bed
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

data.name: Charjabug

attacks.name: Shocking Jaws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

data.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A descendant of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.

attacks.name: Bounce Off
attacks.text: If Magneton and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, the player controlling the Active Pokémon with the fewest number of Energy cards attached to it switches 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnetic Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon minus the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 1 Benched Pokémon and you have 3, this attack will do 30 damage plus 20 more damage.)

data.name: Seaking
data.flavorText: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

data.name: Spiritomb

attacks.name: Lightless World
attacks.text: Put 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Terrify
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

data.name: Burmy Plant Cloak

abilities.name: Cloak Evolution
abilities.text: Burmy Plant Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

data.flavorText: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.

data.name: Unown [Q]

abilities.name: QUICK
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Q is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown Q and attach Unown Q to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. As long as Unown Q is attached to a Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Baltoy does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Solosis
data.flavorText: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

data.name: M Diancie-EX

Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Diamond Force
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to each of your Pokémon from your opponent's Pokémon-EX. (If this Pokémon is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

data.name: Tornadus

attacks.name: Energy Wheel
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

data.name: Munna
data.flavorText: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

data.name: Light Wigglytuff

attacks.text: Your opponent may choose 1 of his or her Pokémon and search his or her deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon. Your opponent attaches that card to that Pokémon. This counts as evolving that Pokémon. Either way, you may do the same, and then each player who searched shuffles his or her deck.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If two of them brush against each other, they will not be able to separate themselves, as they enjoy touching each other's soft fur too much.

data.name: Swoobat

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

data.name: Primal Kyogre-EX
rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Kyogre-EX, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Gourgeist

attacks.name: Confuse Ray

data.flavorText: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

data.name: Armaldo

attacks.name: Rushing Water
attacks.text: Move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, its body is very sturdy. It skewers prey with its claws to feed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wartortle but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Wartortle with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Charmander

abilities.name: Gather Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Fire Energy card attached to 1 of your other Pokémon and attach it to Charmander. This power can't be used if Charmander is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Many people find it cute and try to hold it, only to be burned by its tail.

data.name: Golurk

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

data.flavorText: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

data.name: Castform Snow-Cloud Form

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Snow-cloud Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Snow-cloud Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Snow-cloud Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Thunderclap Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity instantly downing foes several times its size.

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Remove any number of damage counters from that Pokémon, then draw that many cards.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Gothitelle

abilities.name: Magic Room
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Madkinesis
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

attacks.name: Sacred Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

data.name: Piers
rules: Search your deck for an Energy card and a Darkness Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in Horsea. It became a hot topic.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn't like.

data.name: Cyndaquil

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Cyndaquil.

data.flavorText: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

attacks.name: Magnetic Swirl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic Grip
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Seviper

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 1 more damage counter on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

data.name: Golisopod-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crossing Cut-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Trevenant

abilities.name: Forest's Curse
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tree Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon with Misty in its name and put it onto your Bench. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Ultimate Zone
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
During each player's turn, the player may move an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon to his or her Active Arceus as often as he or she likes.

data.name: Qwilfish

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads you get.

data.flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

data.name: Eelektross

attacks.name: Suction Heal
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slurp Shakedown
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Luxray BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Luxray BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Wild Fury
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

data.name: Mr. Mime-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Evens
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks if that damage is exactly 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160, 180, 200, 220, 240, or 260.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: For each card in your opponent's hand, put 1 damage counter on their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Life Trick-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Pebble Throw
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Flabébé
data.flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

data.name: Raichu BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Raichu BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Grand Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Zygarde

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Geostrike
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.

attacks.name: Super Icy Wind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Landorus

attacks.name: Abundant Harvest
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Hammer
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."

data.name: Salandit

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

data.name: Pelipper

attacks.name: Guzzle
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand and attach them to Pelipper. Remove 2 damage counters for each Energy card attached in this way.

attacks.name: Jet Return
attacks.text: Does 30 times the number of Energy cards attached to Pelipper. Then, put all Energy cards attached to Pelipper on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Shelgon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.

data.name: Drednaw

attacks.name: Vise Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

data.name: Mr. Fuji
rules: Choose a Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle it and any cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Brock's Training
rules: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Geodude, Graveler, Golem, Onix-GX, Cubone, Rhyhorn, Rhydon, or Sudowoodo.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

data.name: Musharna

abilities.name: Forewarn
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card back on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Fluffy Dream
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: With the mist from its forehead, it can create shapes of things from dreams it has eaten.

data.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

data.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

data.name: Marshadow

abilities.name: Let Loose
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may have each player shuffle their hand into their deck and draw 4 cards.

attacks.name: Shadow Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.

data.name: Burmy Sandy Cloak

abilities.name: Cloak Evolution
abilities.text: Burmy Sandy Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

data.flavorText: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

data.name: Castform Sunny Form

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Sunny Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Sunny Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Sunny Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Castform Sunny Form.

data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

data.name: Manaphy

attacks.name: Deep Sea Swirl
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Life Saver
attacks.text: Put 2 Water Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Scyther.

data.flavorText: It moves so fast as to be invisible to the naked eye. Even when standing still, its camouflage prevents it from being seen.

data.name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

data.flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

data.name: Tauros

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

data.name: Gallade-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Assault Sword
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Cross Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Cross Slash during your next turn.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Hand Trick
attacks.text: Return Aipom and all cards attached to it to your hand. (If you don't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

data.flavorText: It lives atop giant trees. It wraps its tail around a branch so it won't fall off while asleep.

data.name: Crabominable

attacks.name: Gutsy Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself for each damage counter on it.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
